page.title: 10UNIGATE DAIRIES,FENSTANTON
page.content: {Unigate Dairies}stands on the edge of the{High Street.}It is the{biggest {factory in Fenstanton,}employing 134 people. {Unigate lorries collect milk from {farmers}and it is brought back,stored in cylinders ,and filtered through a cloth to take all the bits out .Then it is heated to the right temperature, 72deg.c to kill all the bacteria. It must be cooled very quickly.The milk, cream and skim are seperated.The cream is put into cartons.{ { There are several different types of {milk;}skim with no fat,semi skim with some fat and vitamin D milk especially pasturised for Americans. { The milk is bottled in a bottling {factory.}It has a lid put on telling you what milk it is.It is{delivered to you{7 days a week. { The bottles are recycled.
